goal.ch: “By analyzing classical mechanical systems with vector calculus and linear algebra, the main objective of this course is to prepare the students for more advanced physics courses.“
goal.en: “By analyzing classical mechanical systems with vector calculus and linear algebra, the main objective of this course is to prepare the students for more advanced physics courses.“

outline.ch:
1. Principle of relativity and Newton’s laws
2. Symmetry and Conservation laws
3. Vector Calculus
4. Rigid body
5. Oscillations and Waves (include normal modes)
6. Lagrangian and Hamiltonian dynamics
7. Contiuum mechanics
8. Applications (central force systems, and …)“
outline.en:
1. Principle of relativity and Newton’s laws
2. Symmetry and Conservation laws
3. Vector Calculus
4. Rigid body
5. Oscillations and Waves (include normal modes)
6. Lagrangian and Hamiltonian dynamics
7. Contiuum mechanics
8. Applications (central force systems, and …)“

textbook.ch:
References :
You can choose on of the following 3 books: 
1. Thornton and Marion, “Classical Dynamics of Particles and Systems“
2. Taylor, “Classical Mechanics“
3. Fowles and Cassiday, “Analytical Mechanics“.
Additionally, please have a general physics textbook at hand.  We will need to go through some materials therein.
